Service Reference¶

Documentation Conventions¶

Method and URL

For each API endpoint, the HTTP method and URL are noted with URL path fragment parameters.

URL Parameters

{parameter_name} denotes a required path fragment

[{optional_element}] denotes an optional path fragment

Query String

Any optional URL query parameters will be noted. These are provided in the URL using ?name=value Request Body If required, an example of a request body.

Expected Responses

Response descriptions will first describe the HTTP response code and content-type.

Following will be an example of the response body.

Potential Errors

Potential errors will be noted with their HTTP status code and message (messages may subject to changes but along with the status code, should note the nature of the problem). The HTTP services provided by GeoDroid Server are outlined below.

The various HTTP services provided by Boundless Android Server are outlined further in the next sections.

  • Data Service
    • List all data objects
    • Get a single data object
  • Tile Service
    • Get a tile
  • Feature Service
    • Get a feature collection
    • Parameters
    • Query string
    • Get a single feature
    • Parameters
    • Query string
    • Get a tile
    • Parameters

About Boundless

Boundless provides commercial open source software for internet mapping and geospatial application development. We are dedicated to the growth and support of open source software.
